blocks.text: Beginning, the year 1978.
The frigid world of winter from Gordon's office window.
The winter of 1978 is tabbed the worst in 90 years, since the famous blizzards of 1888.

blocks.text: The "Kentucky" rifle is renamed; it should be the Pennsylvania rifle, or better, the Lancaster rifle. Gunsmiths here first produced this famous rifle before the Revolutionary War, a rifle superior to any made in all Europe.
Johnnn, Kathy and Kristen come to Lancaster in early April...shop for glassware in Columbia and metalware in Wrightsville. Kitty entertains Kristen while John and Kathy shop..

pages.full_text:
The "Kentucky" rifle is renamed; it should be the Pennsylvania rifle, or better, the Lancaster rifle. Gunsmiths here first produced this famous rifle before the Revolutionary War, a rifle superior to any made in all Europe.

Johnnn, Kathy and Kristen come to Lancaster in early April...shop for glassware in Columbia and metalware in Wrightsville. Kitty entertains Kristen while John and Kathy shop..
captions: The "Kentucky" rifle is renamed; it should be the Pennsylvania rifle, or better, the Lancaster rifle. Gunsmiths here first produced this famous rifle before the Revolutionary War, a rifle superior to any made in all Europe.
Johnnn, Kathy and Kristen come to Lancaster in early April...shop for glassware in Columbia and metalware in Wrightsville. Kitty entertains Kristen while John and Kathy shop..

The "Kentucky" rifle is renamed; it should be the Pennsylvania rifle, or better, the Lancaster rifle. Gunsmiths here first produced this famous rifle before the Revolutionary War, a rifle superior to any made in all Europe.

Johnnn, Kathy and Kristen come to Lancaster in early April...shop for glassware in Columbia and metalware in Wrightsville. Kitty entertains Kristen while John and Kathy shop..

blocks.text:
April 27 - May 2, 1978
Gordon and Kitty visit John, Kathy and Kristen in Greenwich, Conn., followed by return trip through western Connecticut, Massachusetts and Vermont, and the Adirondacks of New York state.
Total - 1,088 miles.
SCRANTON
Connolly's' home in Greenwich.

blocks.text: Night at Darling Kelly's motel, just over the line in Vermont.
Bennington battle monument.
The museum in Bennington contains memorabilia of the early settlements; and an outstanding collection of the work of Grandma Moses.
Street scene, Manchester, Vt.
Old First Church, Bennetong burial place of the post Robert Frost.

mostly ice covered.

blocks.text: The Parkway Literally travels the backbone of the Southern Highlands.
The further south the more dramatic become the views.
The car's power steering malfunctions causing a half day's delay.
Welcome to Virginia
Drive the Parkway from Roanoke to Charlottesville on way home. Cyclists pause for rest at one of many lookouts; one on Way to Oregon.

blocks.text: In Charlottesville, a native son, George Rogers Clark, brilliant American Revolutionary general, who won outstanding victories in the west...and his brother, William Clark, of Lewis and Clark fame, who in 1803-1806 opened the great American Northwest to knowledge of that vast region.
A tour of Monticello, Jefferson's beloved home for 56 years. Nearby is Jefferson's grave; he died on the 50th anniversary of the Declaration of Independence, largely his creation.

pages.full_text:
In Charlottesville, a native son, George Rogers Clark, brilliant American Revolutionary general, who won outstanding victories in the west...and his brother, William Clark, of Lewis and Clark fame, who in 1803-1806 opened the great American Northwest to knowledge of that vast region.

A tour of Monticello, Jefferson's beloved home for 56 years. Nearby is Jefferson's grave; he died on the 50th anniversary of the Declaration of Independence, largely his creation.

blocks.text: Final stop for a bite to eat in Frederick...some one treats to ice cream cones. Home at 4 p.m.
End - trip to Blue Ridge Parkway.
June 10, 1978 - Gordon and Kitty to Philadelphia to see the Strawbridge Family.
The Hubers from California, whom Gordon and Kitty met in Spain, arrive in their motor home for a visit of two days...show them the Amish country.
Boy up a tree,...grandma disapproves.
Games Indoors... Ben and Blake.

blocks.text: Richard and Nancy are in England for a year at the University of Nottingham, where Richard has an exchange scholarship. A letter arrives with the distressing news that they have agreed to have an amicable separation. There had been no prior indications of differences between them. Nancy plans to fly to California; Richard will remain in England until the end of the school term.
Lancaster ABC holds annual picnic. "P.P." Martin (center of picture) is dead of cancer within five months.
To Chesapeake Bay with the Hamakers: Kitty, John Rohrer, Emmie Rohrbach, Gordon. Polly Rohrer, "Ceppie" Hamaker, Annabelle Hamaker.

pages.full_text:

A letter arrives with the distressing news that they have agreed to have an amicable separation. There had been no prior indications of differences between them. Nancy plans to fly to California; Richard will remain in England until the end of the school term.

Lancaster ABC holds annual picnic. "P.P." Martin (center of picture) is dead of cancer within five months.
